CodeList.Name: AJCC Tumor Grade Response

Description.TranslatedText: Terminology relevant to the American Joint Committee on Cancer (AJCC) tumor grading system responses.

EnumeratedItem.nciodm:CDISCDefinition: A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is well differentiated. (American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 7th ed. New York, NY: Springer; 2010.)

A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is moderately differentiated. (American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 7th ed. New York, NY: Springer; 2010.)

A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is poorly differentiated. (American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 7th ed. New York, NY: Springer; 2010.)

A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that a cancerous lesion is undifferentiated. (American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 7th ed. New York, NY: Springer; 2010.)

A morphologic qualifier by the American Joint Cancer Committee (AJCC) indicating that the grade of a cancerous lesion cannot be assessed. (American Joint Committee on Cancer. AJCC Cancer Staging Manual. 7th ed. New York, NY: Springer; 2010.)

CodeList.nciodm:PreferredTerm: CDISC SDTM AJCC Tumor Grade Response Terminology
